name: Southampton FC History Quiz | Southampton | 10 Questions

questions.text: In which year were the club formed?
questions.explanation:
1885.

	The club's original name was Southampton St. Mary's but they quickly changed it to Southampton FC.

questions.text: Who was the club's first manager in their history?
questions.explanation:
Cecil Knight.

	Knight was manager between 1894-95, followed by Robson (1895-97), Arnfield (1897-1911) and Swift took over for one season between 1911-12. Southampton have had some famous names in the hot seat over the years, including Glenn Hoddle, Graeme Souness, Lawrie McMenemy and Gordon Strachan.

questions.text: Where did the club first play their home matches?
questions.explanation:
Antelope Ground.

	The Antelope Ground was used between 1885-97, followed by the County Cricket Ground for the 1897-98 season, and The Dell was used until 2001, when they moved into St. Mary's Stadium. Matt Le Tissier scored the final goal at The Dell on 19th May, 2001 in a 3-2 victory over Arsenal.

questions.text: In which year did Southampton win the FA Cup for the first time in their history?
questions.explanation:
1976.

	Bobby Stokes scored the only goal of the game in the 83rd minute against Manchester United. This was the only time Southampton won the FA Cup during the 20th century.

questions.text: Which of these made the most League appearances for Southampton?
questions.explanation:
Terry Paine.

	Paine played an incredible 713 League games for Southampton between 1956-74.

questions.text: In which season did Southampton enter the Football League for the first time?
questions.explanation:
1920-21.

	Southampton finished 2nd in the 1920-21 Division Three season, just 5 points behind champions Crystal Palace.

questions.text: Who did Southampton beat in 1965 to set a record for their biggest League victory?
questions.explanation:
Wolverhampton Wanderers.

	The game took place on 18th September, 1965 where Southampton beat Wolves 9-3.

questions.text: Where did Southampton sign Paul Telfer from in 2001?
questions.explanation:
Coventry City.

	Telfer began his career at Luton, and played there between 1988-95 when he joined Coventry. He signed for Southampton on 31st October, 2001.

questions.text: Which of these scored the most League goals for the club?
questions.explanation:
Mike Channon.

	Channon hit the back of the net 185 times between 1966-82.

questions.text: Who won the League title when Southampton finished in second place in the 1983-84 season?
questions.explanation:
Liverpool.

	Southampton finished just three points away from Liverpool, who had 80 points to Southampton's 77.
